alert.note: Alert for Macomb (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 7:39PM EDT until August 03 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following county, Macomb. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 737 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - The heavier rain is quickly exiting to the east. Light to briefly moderate rain will continue into the evening. Additional rainfall will generally be a half inch or less. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Warren, St. Clair Shores, Mount Clemens, New Baltimore, Richmond, Romeo, Sterling Heights, Clinton, Armada, Memphis, Macomb Township, Roseville, Eastpointe, Grosse Pointe Woods, Fraser, Harper Woods, Center Line, Utica, New Haven and Washington. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
